definition: (polite) thank you for your trouble (used when asking a favor or after having received one)
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
a good dog deserves a bone (idiom)

sentences.english: Why did no one inform me of the change of plans?
sentences.chinese: 有劳博友告诉我正确的改法。

sentences.english: Would you kindly spell it for me?
Only striker Raul Gonzalez has been at Madrid longer than Guti.
sentences.chinese: 只有劳尔在皇马效力的时间比古蒂长。

sentences.english: This is Echizen's cat, there are workers, thank you.
sentences.chinese: 这是越前的猫，有劳了，谢谢。

sentences.english: The past seems like a song, as well as a dream and fog.
sentences.chinese: 把“往事如歌，如梦如烟”译成英文，有劳各位了。

sentences.english: A. Will you please find someone else for the chairmanship?
sentences.chinese: 有劳你另外找人做主席好吗？

sentences.english: A. Would you please repair the TV for me?
The author raises the question "what about pain without gain?" because.
sentences.chinese: 作者提出“有劳无获”的问题是因为。

definition: to inconvenience/to trouble (sb with a request)
to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/vexation/inconvenience
many thanks/thanks a lot
undue trouble/Thank you for having gone out of your way to help me.
deference is no substitute for obedience (idiom)/(said to accept sb's request, invitation etc)
pinyin: gong1 jing4 bu4 ru2 cong2 ming4

definition: to speak seriously/to exaggerate
Please do as you wish!/You are welcome to do whatever you like!/Please make yourself at home.
can't thank sb enough (idiom)
to refuse would be impolite
too polite/overcourteous
to cup one's hands in obeisance or greeting/(fig.) submissive
to cup one fist in the other hand (as a sign of respect)
to return a politeness/to present a gift in return
to be indebted (to sb)
to petition for retirement (old)/to ask for leave to withdraw/to ask to be excused
lit. I'm ashamed and dare not (accept the honor); fig. I do not deserve your praise./You flatter me too much.
